body_html: I don't think we should add this, np.byte is and int8, but for us it's an uint8, which seems confusing. Also, byte in pytorch sometimes really means bool. So I'd say ask for what you want: if you want a uint8, use that, if you want a bool, use that (we need to implement bool tensors though).

body: I don't think we should add this, np.byte is and int8, but for us it's an uint8, which seems confusing.  Also, byte in pytorch sometimes really means bool.  So I'd say ask for what you want: if you want a uint8, use that, if you want a bool, use that (we need to implement bool tensors though).
